title: Miho Oki
text: is a Japanese former women's <a href="racing%20cyclist">racing cyclist</a>. Born in the northern island of <a href="Hokkaido">Hokkaido</a>, she originally trained to be a <a href="speed%20skater">speed skater</a>, but switched to cycling when she was 22. She won the first <a href="Japanese%20National%20Road%20Race%20Championships">Japanese National Road Race Championships</a> for women held in 1998, a title she ended up winning eleven straight times. From 2002, she became the first Japanese to participate on the women's pro tour in Europe, riding for French, Italian, and Dutch teams. She won the Trophée des Grimpeurs in 2002. She represented Japan at the <a href="Cycling%20at%20the%202000%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%20road%20race">2000</a>, <a href="Cycling%20at%20the%202004%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%20road%20race">2004</a>, and <a href="Cycling%20at%20the%202008%20Summer%20Olympics%20%E2%80%93%20Women%27s%20road%20race">2008 Summer Olympics</a>. She retired in 2008 and currently serves as an adviser for women's <a href="keirin">keirin</a>.
